pl.cnf

Class Literal

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.cnf.Literal

  • public class Literal
extends java.lang.Object
    A Literal is either a Symbol or the negation of an Symbol.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Literal.Polarity
      Enumeration of possible polarities of a Literal (positive or negative).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Symbol content
      The Symbol that is the content of this literal.
      protected Literal.Polarity polarity
      The Polarity (positive or negative) of this Literal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Literal(Sentence s)
      Return a new Literal constructed from the given Sentence s, which must be an Symbol or the negation of an Symbol (i.e., a UnaryCompoundSentence whose connective is NOT and whose argument is an Symbol).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

      Return the Polarity (positive or negative) of this Literal.

      Returns a hash code value for the object.

      Return true if this Literal is satisfied by the given Model.

      Return the string representation of this Literal.

      • Literal

        public Literal(Sentence s)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return a new Literal constructed from the given Sentence s, which must be an Symbol or the negation of an Symbol (i.e., a UnaryCompoundSentence whose connective is NOT and whose argument is an Symbol).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return the string representation of this Literal.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • isSatisfiedBy

        public boolean isSatisfiedBy(Model model)
        Return true if this Literal is satisfied by the given Model. That is, if this is a positive Literal, its content must be assigned true by the Model, or if it is a negative Literals, its content must be assigned false by the Model.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. Two Literals are equal iff they have the same polarity and content. Implementing this requires also implementing Object.hashCode(), per the description of Object.equals(java.lang.Object).
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value for the object. If two objects are equal according to the Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method, then calling the hashCode method on each of the two objects must produce the same integer result.

        My implementation uses a product sum algorithm with a prime base over the polarity and content of the Literal.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        Wikipedia entry for Java hashCode()
